intro: Pleogyne, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Pleogyne thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a valuable plant for ecological restoration and ornamental gardening.
